original: de ni / mkhas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni / mkhas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyang ma yin no //

analyzed: yul dang dus shes pa ma yin no //

original: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi khyad par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi khyad par shes pa ma yin no //

analyzed: rang gi stobs rnams dang gzhan gyi stobs rnams kyi khyad par shes pa ma yin no //

analyzed: dus su legs par dgos pa rnams sgrub pa ma yin te /

original: de'i bya ba rnams thams cad la bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bya ba rnams thams cad la bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: When he has conquered laziness in this world and the next through the development of perseverance, then he will be able to proceed in the world.🔽He who rises early, conquers fatigue, conquers sleep, and awakens at the proper time, who is not attached to his own side, who is not hostile to the other side, who is not confused about the means, and who is not lazy, will succeed in all his goals.

original: snga bar langs par byed pa dang ngal dub las ba rgyal ba dang gnyid las brgyal zhing legs par sad pa dang / dus su langs pa dang dus su skyo ba skye ba dang ltos pa dang bral bas bya ba rnams rtsom par byed do; ;de lus kyi brtson 'grus brtan pa dang ldan pas le lo'i dri ma de dag rnams dag par bkrus pa'i brtson 'grus legs par rtsom pa🔽de ni / don rnams thams cad dri @36a *//

translated: He who is endowed with physical perseverance, who has washed away the stains of laziness, and who has properly undertaken perseverance

original: ma dang kun nas bral bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: ma dang kun nas bral bar sgrub par byed do //

analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis bar chad byed pa'ang ma yin no // rab tu brten pas bya ba rnams kyang rtsom par byed do //

analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pas gang dag sgrub par byed pa rnams ni /

original: kun nas nyams par yang mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdag gi dpung dang gzhan gyi dpung rnams kyi khyad par shes par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de de dag rnams kyis kyang bsngags par 'gyur ro //

original: sems stobs dang stobs rnams kyang nyams pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems stobs dang stobs rnams kyang nyams pa med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: grong khyer gzhan dag na'ang mngon par dga'o //

analyzed: 'jig rten dag na'ang 'di kun gyis shes par 'gyur ro //

translated: Then, the great being, with such firm armor and free from confusion, will definitely defeat the army of Māra.

analyzed: par 'thob pa'i dgos pa kun nas rtsom par byed do //

analyzed: 'khor ba pa rnams thams cad kyi 'ching ba yin te /

translated: Those who have given up such a household life, who have put on the saffron-colored robes, and who are endowed with striving have gone forth from the household life.

analyzed: khyim gyi gnas kyi 'ching ba rnams las grol bas thar ba mthar phyin pa'i lam thob nas bsam gtan dang kha ton dag la brtson pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Liberated from the fetters of the household life, they have attained the path that leads to the completion of liberation. They are endowed with striving in meditative absorption and recitation.

analyzed: brtson 'grus pha rol gnon pa rnams mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du thar ba la 'jug par byed do //
translated: The one who is energetic and powerful causes them to enter into liberation in accordance with their aspirations.

original: de la legs par ston pa /
analyzed: de la legs par ston pa /

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa /
translated: is the one who is energetic.

original: dus rab tu shes pa /
analyzed: dus rab tu shes pa /
translated: The one who knows the right time

original: lus dang ngag gi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa /

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid shes pa; phung po rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid shes pa; phung po rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa /
translated: knows the reality of their own characteristics, knows the reality of the arising and cessation of the aggregates,

original: nyin dang mtshan du'ang brtson pa mi 'dor ba des rab tu brtson pas kyang slob dpon la legs par brten pas dang ye shes mang du spel bas kyang kun nas rtsom par byed do //🔽brtun par byed /🔽rab tu 'bad par byed /
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du'ang brtson pa mi 'dor ba des rab tu brtson pas kyang slob dpon la legs par brten pas dang ye shes mang du spel bas kyang kun nas rtsom par byed do // brtun par byed / rab tu 'bad par byed /
translated: and does not abandon striving day and night.🔽The one who is energetic🔽strives,🔽exerts himself,

original: lam goms par byed /
analyzed: lam goms par byed /
translated: and cultivates the path.

original: skyon spang bar byed @37b de thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs par gyur pa 'khor ba'i 'ching bar gyur ba don med pa rnams thams cad byed pa /
analyzed: skyon spang bar byed @37b de thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs par gyur pa 'khor ba'i 'ching bar gyur ba don med pa rnams thams cad byed pa /
translated: He abandons the faults that have been present since beginningless time, the bonds of cyclic existence, all that is meaningless,

original: mun par byed pa'i 'os su gyur pa /
analyzed: mun par byed pa'i 'os su gyur pa /
translated: all that is fit to be darkness,

original: don ma yin pa rnams thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: don ma yin pa rnams thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa /
translated: the cause of all that is not meaningful,

original: srog chags rnams la shin tu 'thas par gyur pa /
analyzed: srog chags rnams la shin tu 'thas par gyur pa /
translated: and the great fetter of living beings.

original: de dag rnams kun nas brtsams pa'i brtson 'grus kyis spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag rnams kun nas brtsams pa'i brtson 'grus kyis spong bar byed do //
translated: He abandons them all through the effort that is undertaken.

original: de ji lta ji ltar lam rnams thob par gyur pa de lta de ltar phyir zhing nyid kyang spro ba skye bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar lam rnams thob par gyur pa de lta de ltar phyir zhing nyid kyang spro ba skye bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The more he attains the path, the more he generates enthusiasm.

analyzed: brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pas bral ba'i 'bras bu rnams ci nas kyang 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Through the effort that is undertaken, he causes the fruits of separation to arise.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'ching bar gyur pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'ching bar gyur pa /
translated: The fetters of the afflicted phenomena

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams thams cad kyi yid kun nas 'phrog par byed pa'i yul rnams la chags par mi byed do //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams thams cad kyi yid kun nas 'phrog par byed pa'i yul rnams la chags par mi byed do // 'di lta ste /
translated: He does not become attached to objects that captivate the minds of all childish beings.

original: 'dod pa'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri rnams kyis dge ba'i rdzas gang yin pa rnams rku ba /🔽'drid pa'i chos can /

translated: He steals the wealth of the wholesome that is in accord with the desire realm: sounds, textures, tastes, forms, and smells.🔽He is a deceiver.

original: rnam par slu ba'i chos can /
analyzed: rnam par slu ba'i chos can /
translated: He is a trickster.

original: don ma yin pa rnams thams cad byed pa /
analyzed: don ma yin pa rnams thams cad byed pa /
translated: He creates all that is unbeneficial.

original: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba /
translated: He is an undesirable ripening.

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'ching ba'i chos su gyur pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo yongs su ma spangs pa rnams thams cad kyi sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa dang / rnam par rmongs par byed pa'i yul gyi dgra de dag rnams thams @38a *//

translated: He is an undesirable fetter. He is an enemy of objects that distract and confuse the minds of all childish ordinary beings who have not completely abandoned him.

original: cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: cad spong bar byed do //
translated: He abandons all of them.

original: ro myang bar mi byed pa'i thar pa'i lam sgom par byed do //
analyzed: ro myang bar mi byed pa'i thar pa'i lam sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the path to liberation that does not savor them.

original: sems dri ma med par byed do //
analyzed: sems dri ma med par byed do //
translated: He purifies the mind.

translated: To the extent that he purifies the mind, to that extent he becomes endowed with energy, endowed with mindfulness, endowed with wonder, endowed with vigilance, and endowed with the destruction of the enemies.

analyzed: gzhan yang brtson 'grus de nyid kyis spro ba dang bcas pa gang yin pas 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams rab tu 'joms par byed do //
translated: Moreover, by means of that very energy, he becomes endowed with enthusiasm, and thus he destroys desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: rnam par bral bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par bral bar byed do //
translated: He becomes free from them.

original: rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyal bar byed do //
translated: He becomes victorious over them.

original: yang srid pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang srid pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: He does not come under their control.

original: dgra rnams las rgyal ba mi mthun pa rnams las rgyal ba de ni /
analyzed: dgra rnams las rgyal ba mi mthun pa rnams las rgyal ba de ni /
translated: He becomes victorious over the enemies, victorious over the adversaries.

original: dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du dang / rab tu dang ba'i chu bzhin du dang / sprin gyi tshogs rnams dang bral bar gyur pas dri ma med pa'i zla ba bzhin du dang / na bun dang bral ba'i dzambu'i gling gi nyi ma bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du dang / rab tu dang ba'i chu bzhin du dang / sprin gyi tshogs rnams dang bral bar gyur pas dri ma med pa'i zla ba bzhin du dang / na bun dang bral ba'i dzambu'i gling gi nyi ma bzhin du ste /

original: de lta de ltar rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam par snang ngo //

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nad pa nad rnams grol ba bzhin du dang / dbul po rnams kyis bar du nor rnyed pa bzhin du dang / mig med pa rnams lam stor nas nags khrod du zhugs pa las lam du bgrod par byed pa de dag rnams bzhin du 'dis mthar thug pa'i tshul khrims shis pa gang yin pa nye bar thob pa dbang @38b du byas nas bsnyen par rdzogs par byas te gnas
translated: Just as a sick person is freed from illness, just as the poor find wealth in between, just as the blind find the path and enter the forest, and just as those who travel on the path find their way, in just such a way, having obtained the ultimate auspiciousness of ethical discipline, having taken control, he was fully ordained and abided.

original: so // ji ltar bdag gi skye ba rnams ni /
analyzed: so // ji ltar bdag gi skye ba rnams ni /

original: zad do // tshangs par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: zad do // tshangs par spyod pa ni /
translated: The pure conduct,

original: spyad do // bdag gi 'di las srid pa gzhan ni /
analyzed: spyad do // bdag gi 'di las srid pa gzhan ni /

analyzed: de'i phyir na thams cad kyis kyang rab tu 'bad pas brtson 'grus brtsams par bya'o //

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa dran ldan pa //

analyzed: gang gis le lo'i dri ma spong //

analyzed: ngam grog 'jigs las rnam par grol //

analyzed: skye bo de ni mtho ris 'gro // le lo chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: Such people will go to the higher realms.🔽Laziness is considered

analyzed: bar chad byed pa yin par 'dod // skyon des nye bar bcom pa yi //
translated: An obstacle to all qualities.🔽People who are destroyed by this fault

original: mi ni sdug bsngal skal ldan yin //
analyzed: mi ni sdug bsngal skal ldan yin //
translated: Are destined for suffering.

original: 'di dang pha rol bde don @39a *//
analyzed: 'di dang pha rol bde don @39a *//

original: gnyer; ;de yis de ni spang bar gyis //

analyzed: bkra shis dang yang de mtshungs 'dod //

translated: “In this way, the ruler of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife will teach the gods the sutras spoken by the Blessed Kāśyapa that he has heard from the gods of the past.

analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa dri ma can gyi chos rnams dkar po'i chos kyis rab tu gzhom par bya'o //

original: 'di yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: Abandoning the conduct of delighting in entering towns and cities,🔽you should always stay in the forest.

analyzed: dge slong las gcig tu bar chad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Delight in the conduct of towns and cities is a single, great obstacle for monks.

original: ji ltar gyur pas she na; dge slong gi bya ba nyid du gyur pa bsam gtan dang kha dog yongs su spangs nas grong ngam grong khyer du 'jug par byed cing gnas par yang byed do //

translated: How does this happen? Having given up the practice of meditation and the practice of the monk, he enters the village or town and stays there.

original: khyim de dang de dag rnams la blo shin tu lhag par chags par gyur nas bud med rnams dang ngam skyes pa dang bcas pa dang yang rung ste /🔽rgyun mi 'chad par 'du 'tshogs kyang byed @39b par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de gal te bud med dang lhan cig tu 'ching bar 'gyur ba rnams thams cad byed do //

analyzed: ji ltar gang me la nye ba nyid du gnas pa de ni /

analyzed: nye bar sreg par 'gyur ro; ;de bzhin du'ang gang bud med rnams dang nye bar gnas par byed pa de'i sems rnam par 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if a monk associates with women, his mind will become confused.

original: rgyu mtshan de'i phyir na dge slong gis grong dang grong khyer rnams su 'jug par mi bya'o //🔽gal te skyes pa dag dang lhan cig tu 'du 'tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de'i phyir na dge slong gis grong dang grong khyer rnams su 'jug par mi bya'o // gal te skyes pa dag dang lhan cig tu 'du 'tshogs pa'am /
translated: For this reason, a monk should not enter villages or towns.🔽If he associates with men,

original: gzhan rnams dang yang kun rjod par byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan rnams dang yang kun rjod par byed pa de dag ni /
translated: or if he talks with others,

analyzed: bya ba rnams thams cad las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will lose all his activities.

analyzed: 'di'i sems zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //

analyzed: dge slong grong dang grong khyer rnams su 'jug pa la dga' ba'i spyod pa'i dbang gis bar chad chen por gyur pa gzhan rnams nyid kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te / de las 'di dag rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: “ ‘There are other great obstacles for a monk who delights in entering villages and towns.🔽What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: khyim nas khyim rnams su 'jug pa'i dge slong ni /
analyzed: khyim nas khyim rnams su 'jug pa'i dge slong ni /
translated: The monk who goes from house to house

original: sems rnam par g-yos par 'gyur ro //🔽khyim rnams kyi nye bar spyod par bya ba rnams yongs su rtogs shing zas dang skom gyi longs @40a *//
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yos par 'gyur ro // khyim rnams kyi nye bar spyod par bya ba rnams yongs su rtogs shing zas dang skom gyi longs @40a *//
translated: will have a disturbed mind.

original: spyod dag mngon par mthong nas spangs kyang de nam zhig na slar yang mi mnyam pa rnams la 'jug par rtsom ste /
analyzed: spyod dag mngon par mthong nas spangs kyang de nam zhig na slar yang mi mnyam pa rnams la 'jug par rtsom ste /
translated: Having understood the enjoyments of the householders, and having seen the enjoyments of food and drink, he will give them up. But later on, he will again begin to engage with the uneven.

original: nags kyi nang nas ci nas kyang khyim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nags kyi nang nas ci nas kyang khyim par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will become a householder, even though he is from the forest.

original: nags na gnas pa'i dga' ba las yongs su nyams par gyur nas de phyir yang khyim gyi gnas kyi 'ching ba'i skyon de nyid kyis kun nas bcings par gyur nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: nags na gnas pa'i dga' ba las yongs su nyams par gyur nas de phyir yang khyim gyi gnas kyi 'ching ba'i skyon de nyid kyis kun nas bcings par gyur nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams la spyod do //
translated: Having fallen from the joy of living in the forest, he will again be bound by the faults of the bonds of household life. He will engage in desire, anger, and ignorance.

analyzed: de nyes pa de dag rnams kyi skyon gyis phyir yang dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su skye ba yin no //
translated: Due to the faults of those faults, he will again be born in the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: sdug bsngal de dag rnams kyi rtsa ba'ang grong dang grong khyer du 'jug pa'i spyod pa la dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de dag rnams kyi rtsa ba'ang grong dang grong khyer du 'jug pa'i spyod pa la dga' ba yin no //
translated: The root of all these sufferings is the delight in the conduct of entering villages and towns.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i dge slong yin par 'dod pa de dag rnams yongs su spongs shig /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i dge slong yin par 'dod pa de dag rnams yongs su spongs shig /

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i skyon de dag rnams kyang gang gis spong na /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i skyon de dag rnams kyang gang gis spong na /
translated: How does one give up such faults?

original: gcig tu dgon pa na gnas pas so //
analyzed: gcig tu dgon pa na gnas pas so //
translated: By living in the forest.

original: dgon pa na gnas pa de'ang mthar thug pa'i yon tan rnams thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa mchog tu bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas pa de'ang mthar thug pa'i yon tan rnams thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa mchog tu bzang ba yin no //
translated: Living in the forest is the best support for the ultimate good qualities.

original: gcig pu dgon pa na gnas par dga' ba'i dge slong ni /
analyzed: gcig pu dgon pa na gnas par dga' ba'i dge slong ni /
translated: A monk who delights in living alone in the forest

original: dbang po rnams zhi ba dang / sems shin tu rab tu dang ba dang / blo legs par ba tul ba'i gser dang mtshungs pa dang / mchog tu zhi ba dang / dbang po rnams mchog tu bsdams pa dang / 'jigs pa'i dri ma rnams dang rnam par @40b bral ba dang /
analyzed: dbang po rnams zhi ba dang / sems shin tu rab tu dang ba dang / blo legs par ba tul ba'i gser dang mtshungs pa dang / mchog tu zhi ba dang / dbang po rnams mchog tu bsdams pa dang / 'jigs pa'i dri ma rnams dang rnam par @40b bral ba dang /
translated: has peaceful faculties, a very clear mind, a well-tamed intelligence like gold, supreme peace, his faculties well-restrained, and is free from the stains of fear.

original: mchog tu gtsang bar gyur pa'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba rnams gang yin pa 'thob par byed do //
analyzed: mchog tu gtsang bar gyur pa'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba rnams gang yin pa 'thob par byed do //
translated: They attain the supreme, utterly pure, undefiled bliss.

original: bde ba de'i khyad par rnams kyis na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i rigs drug po 'di dag rnams thams cad kyis kyang yang dag pa'i legs pa dang ldan par gyur cing kun gyis kyang gang sngon las rnams gcig tu byas par gyur la /
analyzed: bde ba de'i khyad par rnams kyis na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i rigs drug po 'di dag rnams thams cad kyis kyang yang dag pa'i legs pa dang ldan par gyur cing kun gyis kyang gang sngon las rnams gcig tu byas par gyur la /
translated: Compared to the qualities of that bliss, all the six types of gods in the desire realm are inferior, and all of them have previously created the same karma.

original: de'ang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba mchog tu mtshungs pa med pa'i lha gcig gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur gyur cing 'dod pa na spyod pa 'di dag rnams kyi bde ba rnams dang kun nas ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa des kyang zag
analyzed: de'ang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba mchog tu mtshungs pa med pa'i lha gcig gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur gyur cing 'dod pa na spyod pa 'di dag rnams kyi bde ba rnams dang kun nas ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa des kyang zag
translated: The ripening result of that karma is the incomparable, supreme, and delightful bliss of a single god. Compared to the bliss of all the gods in the desire realm,

original: pa zad pa'i bde ba gcig gi char yang mi phod cing dper yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: pa zad pa'i bde ba gcig gi char yang mi phod cing dper yang mi bzod do //
translated: the bliss of the exhaustion of defilements is not even a fraction of it, and it cannot even be used as an analogy.

original: dpyad par gyur pa na thams cad du dper yang mi chog go /
analyzed: dpyad par gyur pa na thams cad du dper yang mi chog go /
translated: When analyzed, it cannot even be used as an analogy.

original: de'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig don dam pa'i bde ba 'dod pa des grong khyer du 'jug pa la dga' ba'i bde ba de dag rnams thong la bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba rnams don du gnyer zhing rtag tu gcig tu nyid mngon par dga' bas
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig don dam pa'i bde ba 'dod pa des grong khyer du 'jug pa la dga' ba'i bde ba de dag rnams thong la bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba rnams don du gnyer zhing rtag tu gcig tu nyid mngon par dga' bas
translated: Therefore, those who desire ultimate happiness should give up the pleasures of enjoying the city and instead pursue the happiness of meditative concentration and meditative absorption, and always delight in solitude.

original: ri khrod dang ri'i phug dang dgon pa rnams su rtsva sog gi stan la gcig tu gnas par 'gyur bar gyis shig /
analyzed: ri khrod dang ri'i phug dang dgon pa rnams su rtsva sog gi stan la gcig tu gnas par 'gyur bar gyis shig /
translated: They should live alone in mountain retreats, mountain caves, and isolated places, on beds of straw.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba la mngon par dga' bas gnas pa'i dge slong rnams ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba la mngon par dga' bas gnas pa'i dge slong rnams ni /
translated: Monks who live in this way, delighting in undefiled happiness,

original: grogs po dang gnyen 'brel dang rang gi skye bo rnams lta bar byed pas @41a *//🔽rnam par rgyu ba sten par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: grogs po dang gnyen 'brel dang rang gi skye bo rnams lta bar byed pas @41a *// rnam par rgyu ba sten par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: do not visit their friends, relatives, and family.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: They do not keep company with them.

original: de rang gi skye bo dang grogs po dang gnyen 'brel rnams la lta bas rnam par rgyu ba bsten par gyur na /
analyzed: de rang gi skye bo dang grogs po dang gnyen 'brel rnams la lta bas rnam par rgyu ba bsten par gyur na /
translated: If they do visit their friends, relatives, and family,

original: de rang gi skye bo dang grogs po dang gnyen 'bral rnams dang phrad pa las byung ba'i bde ba rnams ni /
analyzed: de rang gi skye bo dang grogs po dang gnyen 'bral rnams dang phrad pa las byung ba'i bde ba rnams ni /
translated: The happiness that comes from meeting with one’s family, friends, and relatives

original: 'jig pa dang mi brtan pa dang mi rtag pa dang mthar rnam par 'bral ba de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang mi brtan pa dang mi rtag pa dang mthar rnam par 'bral ba de dag rnams ni /
translated: is perishable, unstable, impermanent, and in the end, it is separation.

original: mchog tu mthar phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu mthar phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the highest, ultimate happiness.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang bcas pa dang / de ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang bcas pa dang / de ni /
translated: It is accompanied by afflictions,

original: dri ma dang skyon dang gnod pa dang bcas pa dang gcig tu nges pa ma yin pa 'jigs pa dang bcas par gcig tu nges pa dpe med pa rnams las rnam par ma grol ba yin no //
analyzed: dri ma dang skyon dang gnod pa dang bcas pa dang gcig tu nges pa ma yin pa 'jigs pa dang bcas par gcig tu nges pa dpe med pa rnams las rnam par ma grol ba yin no //
translated: and it is not free from faults, problems, and dangers, and it is not certain, and it is not unique, and it is not beyond compare.

original: de'i phyir na blo gros dman par gyur pa gang 'ga' zhig gis don dam pa'i bde ba rnams kun nas dor nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa sdug bsngal rnams tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na blo gros dman par gyur pa gang 'ga' zhig gis don dam pa'i bde ba rnams kun nas dor nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa sdug bsngal rnams tshol bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, some people of inferior intelligence, having completely rejected the ultimate happiness, seek out the happiness that is accompanied by defilements, which is not in accord with the Dharma, and which is suffering.

original: de ni / 'od bor bar gyur nas mun pa tshol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni / 'od bor bar gyur nas mun pa tshol bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar yang gnyen bshes dang grogs po dang rang gi skye bo rnams dang phrad pa la mngon par dga' ba'i dge slong ni /

original: blo de la song bar gyur ba dang / de rjes su sgrub par byed pa dang / de la rab tu 'byams par gyur pa dang / des brel dog tu gyur nas nyin mo dang mtshan mo med par yang bsam gtan blo la byed pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: blo de la song bar gyur ba dang / de rjes su sgrub par byed pa dang / de la rab tu 'byams par gyur pa dang / des brel dog tu gyur nas nyin mo dang mtshan mo med par yang bsam gtan blo la byed pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: becomes absorbed in that thought, pursues it, becomes attached to it, and is so busy with it that he does not practice concentration day or night.

original: kha ton yang mi byed cing bla ma la legs par bsten pa'i dbang gis gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: kha ton yang mi byed cing bla ma la legs par bsten pa'i dbang gis gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: They do not recite the scriptures, nor do they abide in the teachings by relying on a spiritual master.

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rjes su sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rjes su sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: They do not perform worship of the Three Jewels.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus kyi las su bya ba rnams rjes su dran par byed pa dang / gzhan la ston pa dang / ngag gi las dang yid kyi las dang rnam pa gsum byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus kyi las su bya ba rnams rjes su dran par byed pa dang / gzhan la ston pa dang / ngag gi las dang yid kyi las dang rnam pa gsum byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not remember, teach others, or themselves engage in the three types of actions of body, speech, and mind that are to be done in a future life.

original: blo de la song ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: blo de la song ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: They only have the thought of that.

original: ji lta ba @47b bzhin du nga dang nga'i gnyen bshes rnams dang grogs po dang rang gi skye bo rnams ma mthong na /🔽de dag rnams kyi khyim gyi bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba @47b bzhin du nga dang nga'i gnyen bshes rnams dang grogs po dang rang gi skye bo rnams ma mthong na / de dag rnams kyi khyim gyi bya ba ni /
translated: “When they do not see their friends, relatives, companions, and family members,🔽they think, ‘What is happening in their homes?

original: ci dang ci ltar gyur tam /
analyzed: ci dang ci ltar gyur tam /
translated: What are they doing?

original: yang de dag gi gson pa rnams kyang ji ltar gyur tam zhes de de ltar yid la byas nas mya ngan gyis gzir bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de dag gi gson pa rnams kyang ji ltar gyur tam zhes de de ltar yid la byas nas mya ngan gyis gzir bar 'gyur te /
translated: What is happening to them?’ Thinking in this way, they are tormented by sorrow.

original: gang gi don du de lta bu rnams las nges par grol bar bya ba'i don du nags su gnas par gyur pa las de nyid la rjes su 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi don du de lta bu rnams las nges par grol bar bya ba'i don du nags su gnas par gyur pa las de nyid la rjes su 'jug par byed do //
translated: For the sake of what? For the sake of being liberated from such things. But then, having gone to the forest, he engages in just that.

original: blo gros ngan par gyur pa mi g-yo ba'i mi mya ngan can /
analyzed: blo gros ngan par gyur pa mi g-yo ba'i mi mya ngan can /
translated: He is a man of bad understanding, a man of no constancy, a man of sorrow.🔽Having abandoned his own sorrow, which is made by birth, old age, sickness, and death, he sorrows over the sorrow of others.

original: skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi bas byas pa'i rang gi mya ngan rnams yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi mya ngan gyis mya ngan du byed pa dang / de mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i rang gi skye bo rnams dang / gnyen bshes rnams dang phrad pa'i dra ba 'dir nges par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi bas byas pa'i rang gi mya ngan rnams yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi mya ngan gyis mya ngan du byed pa dang / de mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i rang gi skye bo rnams dang / gnyen bshes rnams dang phrad pa'i dra ba 'dir nges par 'jug par byed do //
translated: He enters this net of meeting with his own people and relatives, who are equal to no one.

original: de nas yang des gnyen bshes de rnams mngon par mthong nas gdung bas gdungs shing gzhan gyi zas bsod pa rnams za bas khyim nas khyim rnams su phe'u 'debs pa'i ston mo rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas yang des gnyen bshes de rnams mngon par mthong nas gdung bas gdungs shing gzhan gyi zas bsod pa rnams za bas khyim nas khyim rnams su phe'u 'debs pa'i ston mo rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having seen those relatives, he is tormented by longing. He eats the good food of others and delights in the festivals that go from house to house.

original: khyim de dang 'brel par gyur pa'i don dag ni /
analyzed: khyim de dang 'brel par gyur pa'i don dag ni /
translated: The events that took place in the house were as follows.

original: byed la nyan par yang byed do //
analyzed: byed la nyan par yang byed do //
translated: He listens to the affairs of the household.

original: des de dag rnams yid la byas nas de dag rnams las gzhan yang byed do //
analyzed: des de dag rnams yid la byas nas de dag rnams las gzhan yang byed do //
translated: He thinks about them and then does something else.

original: de khyim gyi 'tsho tshis rnams byed pas rang gi don rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de khyim gyi 'tsho tshis rnams byed pas rang gi don rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is preoccupied with the affairs of the household and so neglects his own duties.

original: @48a *// 'jig rten pha rol tu gyur pa rnams kyi 'jigs pa dag sems par mi byed do //
analyzed: @48a *// 'jig rten pha rol tu gyur pa rnams kyi 'jigs pa dag sems par mi byed do //
translated: He does not think about the fear of the next world.

original: dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba pa rnams su 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba rnams sems par mi byed do //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba pa rnams su 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba rnams sems par mi byed do //
translated: He does not think about death and rebirth in the realms of hell-beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: 'di pa'i 'jigs pa rnams kyang sems par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di pa'i 'jigs pa rnams kyang sems par mi byed de /
translated: He does not think about the fear of this world.

original: rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang sdug pa rnams dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa rnams dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba rnams thams cad kyang tha dad du 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ba rnam par 'bral ba so sor gnas pa rnams sems par mi byed do //
analyzed: rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang sdug pa rnams dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa rnams dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba rnams thams cad kyang tha dad du 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ba rnam par 'bral ba so sor gnas pa rnams sems par mi byed do //
translated: He does not think about old age, sickness, death, separation from what is dear, encountering what is not dear, or the separation from all that is dear and pleasant.

original: de srid pa de srid du gnyen dang grogs po rnams kun tu sten par byed do //
analyzed: de srid pa de srid du gnyen dang grogs po rnams kun tu sten par byed do //
translated: He associates with friends and relatives for as long as he lives.

original: gnyen bshes dang grogs po rnams lta bar byed pa mngon par 'dod pa mthun par byed pa gzhan gyi zas za ba gzhan gyi khyim sgo ston par byed pa gang yin pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gnyen bshes dang grogs po rnams lta bar byed pa mngon par 'dod pa mthun par byed pa gzhan gyi zas za ba gzhan gyi khyim sgo ston par byed pa gang yin pa rnams ni /
translated: He desires to see friends and relatives, to do what is agreeable to them, to eat the food of others, to be shown the door of others’ houses,

original: lus zhig nas ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zhig nas ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and after the break-up of the body, he is reborn in the hells, an evil destination, a bad place, a place of suffering.

original: yi dvags kyi yul rnams dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'ang ngal du ba dang bcas pa'i 'gros bla lhag par gyur pas de srid du yongs su 'khyams so //
analyzed: yi dvags kyi yul rnams dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'ang ngal du ba dang bcas pa'i 'gros bla lhag par gyur pas de srid du yongs su 'khyams so //
translated: They wander in the realms of hungry ghosts and animals, with great difficulty and hardship.

original: dmyal ba rnams su skyes pa na'ang tshor ba drag po rnams kyis zil gyis mnan pa rnams la grogs pos ma yin zhing gnyen bshes rnams kyis @48b kyang bsil bar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams ni /🔽cung zad kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams su skyes pa na'ang tshor ba drag po rnams kyis zil gyis mnan pa rnams la grogs pos ma yin zhing gnyen bshes rnams kyis @48b kyang bsil bar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams ni / cung zad kyang mi byed do //
translated: Even when born in the hells, they are overwhelmed by intense pain, and no friend or relative can offer them any relief.

original: de'i phyir na dge slong rnams thams cad kyis tshul rnams thams cad nas dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba pa'i 'jigs pas 'jigs pa rnams kyis kyang gnyen bshes dang grogs po rnams dang phrad par 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na dge slong rnams thams cad kyis tshul rnams thams cad nas dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba pa'i 'jigs pas 'jigs pa rnams kyis kyang gnyen bshes dang grogs po rnams dang phrad par 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, monks, you should be afraid of the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals, and you should not desire to meet with friends and relatives.

original: de dag rnams dang 'du 'tshog byas pas kyang ni don ma yin pa drag po rnams byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag rnams dang 'du 'tshog byas pas kyang ni don ma yin pa drag po rnams byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of associating with them, you will do terrible things that are not good.

original: de la dmigs par byed pa dang / don des kyang gang gi phyir sred pa rnams zad par bya ba'i don du rab tu byung ba las sred pa de nyid la sred pas ston par byed pa na /
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa dang / don des kyang gang gi phyir sred pa rnams zad par bya ba'i don du rab tu byung ba las sred pa de nyid la sred pas ston par byed pa na /
translated: And, for the sake of eliminating craving, they go forth from the home life. But then they teach craving itself as the path.

original: de ni / mchog tu yang byis par gyur pa rnams kyis bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni / mchog tu yang byis par gyur pa rnams kyis bsten pa yin no //
translated: This is the highest folly.

original: gang dag kho na bcom nas rab tu byung ba'ang dra ba de nyid du blo 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: gang dag kho na bcom nas rab tu byung ba'ang dra ba de nyid du blo 'jug pa ni /
translated: Those who go forth from the home life after destroying their bonds, but then allow their minds to become entangled in those very bonds,

original: blo gros dman pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gros dman pa yin te /
translated: are of little intelligence.

original: yang 'ga' zhig ji ltar me'i 'jigs pa spangs pa las me de nyid du nye bar sten par byed do //
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig ji ltar me'i 'jigs pa spangs pa las me de nyid du nye bar sten par byed do //
translated: Some people avoid fire out of fear of being burned, but then they touch that very fire.

original: de bzhin du khyim gyi gnas rnams 'jigs nas spangs pa'ang 'jigs pa de nyid du nye bar 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyim gyi gnas rnams 'jigs nas spangs pa'ang 'jigs pa de nyid du nye bar 'jug par byed do //
translated: In the same way, some people leave the home life out of fear of its dangers, but then they return to those very dangers.

original: de bzhin du gang 'ga' zhig gnyen bshes rnams kyi klung chen por nye bar 'gro zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang 'ga' zhig gnyen bshes rnams kyi klung chen por nye bar 'gro zhing /
translated: Some people cross a great river out of fear of a friend.

original: slar yang de dag rnams nyid la nye bar bsten par byed pa de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: slar yang de dag rnams nyid la nye bar bsten par byed pa de dag rnams ni /
translated: But then they go back to relying on that very person.

original: mig med pa dang blo gros bkab pa dang dbang po rnams kun nas ma bsdams pa yin no //
analyzed: mig med pa dang blo gros bkab pa dang dbang po rnams kun nas ma bsdams pa yin no //
translated: They are blind, their intelligence is obscured, and their faculties are not restrained.

original: de @49a *// ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos 'di dag chos gang gis rab tu gzhom par bya na /
analyzed: de @49a *// ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos 'di dag chos gang gis rab tu gzhom par bya na /
translated: In this way, how are these afflicted phenomena to be overcome?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gang shes rab can rnams kyis kyang spang pa dang / gzung bar yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang shes rab can rnams kyis kyang spang pa dang / gzung bar yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Even the wise are unable to abandon and grasp them.

original: de yun ring du byas na gnas pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: de yun ring du byas na gnas pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams kyis ni /
translated: If one cultivates them for a long time, those who delight in abiding

analyzed: rab tu gzhom pa dang gzung bar yang nus pa yin no //
translated: are able to overcome and grasp them.

original: ring du 'gro na lam la gnas pa'ang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ring du 'gro na lam la gnas pa'ang 'di lta ste /
translated: When going far, those who abide on the path are like this:

original: blo gros zhan pa rnams dang gnyen po gzhan gyis kyang gnyen bshes dang grogs po dang rang gi skye bo rnams la gdung sems so sor bzlog par bya bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: blo gros zhan pa rnams dang gnyen po gzhan gyis kyang gnyen bshes dang grogs po dang rang gi skye bo rnams la gdung sems so sor bzlog par bya bar mi nus kyi /
translated: Even with other antidotes, the weak-minded are unable to individually avert their affection for relatives, friends, and their own people.

original: de'ang yun ring du 'gro na 'gro bar gyur pas tha mar ni /
analyzed: de'ang yun ring du 'gro na 'gro bar gyur pas tha mar ni /
translated: However, if they go far and become habituated, eventually

original: gdung sems de dag rnams rab tu 'joms te /
analyzed: gdung sems de dag rnams rab tu 'joms te /
translated: they will completely overcome that affection.

original: brtse ba'i sems ni /🔽gnas skabs rnams thams cad dang thams cad du ma phrad pas rab tu 'joms pa je dang por ni /
analyzed: brtse ba'i sems ni / gnas skabs rnams thams cad dang thams cad du ma phrad pas rab tu 'joms pa je dang por ni /
translated: The mind of love🔽is completely destroyed by the separation from all that is dear.

original: gdung sems de nyid kyi gnyen po rnams gnas skabs thams cad du rig par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gdung sems de nyid kyi gnyen po rnams gnas skabs thams cad du rig par 'gyur ba 'di ni /

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'dus pa rnams thams cad kyi mtha' ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'dus pa rnams thams cad kyi mtha' ni /
translated: This is as follows.

original: 'bral ba ni /
analyzed: 'bral ba ni /
translated: The end of all gatherings is separation.🔽Death is the separation of the body and mind.

original: 'chi ba'i yul dang dus dang rnams su 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i yul dang dus dang rnams su 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: At the time of death, no one can be found anywhere

original: yongs su skyob par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su skyob par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: who can protect one.

original: 'chi ba'i yul dang dus rnams su ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i yul dang dus rnams su ni /
translated: At the time of death,

original: las nyid kho na gnas skabs rnams thams cad du @49b yongs su skyob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: las nyid kho na gnas skabs rnams thams cad du @49b yongs su skyob par byed pa yin no //
translated: only karma protects one in all situations.

original: skye ba gzhan dag brgya stong du ma rnams su'ang las nyid skyabs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan dag brgya stong du ma rnams su'ang las nyid skyabs su 'gyur te /
translated: In hundreds of thousands of other lives, karma alone is the protector.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du gnyen bshes rnams bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du gnyen bshes rnams bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like a relative in every respect.

original: gnyen bshes rnams kyis ma yin zhing rtsang 'brel rnams sam /
analyzed: gnyen bshes rnams kyis ma yin zhing rtsang 'brel rnams sam /
translated: Not by relatives, not by friends,

original: gzhan dag rnams kyis kyang ma yin no //🔽gnyen bshes rnams gang 'ga' zhig gis kyang skyob par byed pa ma yin pas gcig tu mngon par dga' zhing /
analyzed: gzhan dag rnams kyis kyang ma yin no // gnyen bshes rnams gang 'ga' zhig gis kyang skyob par byed pa ma yin pas gcig tu mngon par dga' zhing /

original: gnyen bshes kyi dbang du bya ba'am rang gi skye bo rnams kyi dbang du byas nas de ltar dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: gnyen bshes kyi dbang du bya ba'am rang gi skye bo rnams kyi dbang du byas nas de ltar dpyod par byed do //
translated: not by any relatives or friends at all.

original: de'i phyir na kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos gzhan 'di ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos gzhan 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this one defiled phenomenon

analyzed: gcig pu mngon par dga' ba'i dge slong gis rab tu gzhom par bya ba yin no //
translated: should be completely destroyed by a monk who delights in solitude.

original: 'chi ba'i yul dang dus rnams sam na ba'i dus dang rgas pa'i dus na'ang 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig la cung zad kyang mi byed do //🔽yongs su skyob par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i yul dang dus rnams sam na ba'i dus dang rgas pa'i dus na'ang 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig la cung zad kyang mi byed do // yongs su skyob par byed pa ni /
translated: In the place of death, at the time of death, at the time of sickness, at the time of old age, no one does anything for anyone else at all.

original: su dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: su dag kyang ma yin no //
translated: No one at all protects anyone else at all.

original: zhes de ltar sems par byed do //
analyzed: zhes de ltar sems par byed do //
translated: Thus he reflects.

original: dge slong 'di'i rang gi skye bo rnams kyis byas pa'i brtse gdung gang yin pa 'di las de dag rnams thams cad du nyams par 'gyur ba'am mgo smad par 'gyur ro; ;de ltar dge slong gnyen bshes la phrad pa'i brtse gdung rnams ni /
analyzed: dge slong 'di'i rang gi skye bo rnams kyis byas pa'i brtse gdung gang yin pa 'di las de dag rnams thams cad du nyams par 'gyur ba'am mgo smad par 'gyur ro; ;de ltar dge slong gnyen bshes la phrad pa'i brtse gdung rnams ni /
translated: All of these will be lost and destroyed by the affection that this monk has for his relatives.

analyzed: byes su 'gro bas rab tu 'bral bar 'gyur ro // gzhan yang kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos nges @50a *//
translated: In this way, the affection that a monk feels for his relatives will be destroyed by his going away.

original: par 'byung bas rab tu gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: par 'byung bas rab tu gzhom par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, you should overcome the afflictions with the Dharma of renunciation.

original: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste don med pa smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste don med pa smra ba ste /
translated: It is this: useless speech.

original: khyim pa yin yang rung gang dang gang skye bo thams cad kyang rtsva dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim pa yin yang rung gang dang gang skye bo thams cad kyang rtsva dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whether one is a householder or not, all people are just like grass.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gang gi phyir ngag gi tshig rnams ni /🔽nor yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gang gi phyir ngag gi tshig rnams ni / nor yin gyi /
translated: It is this:🔽Speech is wealth.

original: nor gzhan ni /
analyzed: nor gzhan ni /
translated: Other kinds of wealth

original: tha ma yin no //🔽skyes bu rnams ni /
analyzed: tha ma yin no // skyes bu rnams ni /
translated: are inferior.🔽People become essential

original: ngag gis snying po can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gis snying po can du 'gyur ro //
translated: through speech.

original: de dang rnam par bral ba ni /
analyzed: de dang rnam par bral ba ni /
translated: “ ‘Those who are free from that

original: snying po med pa dang / nor dang kun nas bral bar 'gyur te /🔽gsog gsob snying po med pa phyugs rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro; ;ngag gi nor rnams dang bral ba ngag dang bral ba'i skyes bu rnams ni /
analyzed: snying po med pa dang / nor dang kun nas bral bar 'gyur te / gsog gsob snying po med pa phyugs rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro; ;ngag gi nor rnams dang bral ba ngag dang bral ba'i skyes bu rnams ni /
translated: will be devoid of wealth and essence.

original: skyes bu'i ming can gyi phyugs rnams yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i ming can gyi phyugs rnams yin no //
translated: They will be like cattle, hollow, empty, and without essence. Those who are devoid of the wealth of speech, who are people without speech, are cattle who are called people.

original: mkhas pa'i skye bo rnams thams cad kyis spangs pa dang / gtsog par gyur pa dang / shin tu'ang tha shal yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i skye bo rnams thams cad kyis spangs pa dang / gtsog par gyur pa dang / shin tu'ang tha shal yin no //
translated: They are abandoned by all wise people, they are despised, and they are the most base.

original: rnam pa de lta bu byed pa'i chos rnams chos gang dag gis rab tu gzhom par bya /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu byed pa'i chos rnams chos gang dag gis rab tu gzhom par bya /

analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil nas rgyu bar 'gyur te /

original: ji ltar rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha rnams rgyu bar byed pa de ltar de dag rnams kyang rgyu pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha rnams rgyu bar byed pa de ltar de dag rnams kyang rgyu pa yin no //
translated: They move about just as the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings do.

original: gal te shed na de dag rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa du mar gyur pa'i dbyangs snyan pa de thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shed na de dag rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa du mar gyur pa'i dbyangs snyan pa de thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they wish, they hear the sweet sounds of the many different kinds of songs.

original: de nas thos par gyur pa dang lha nyid stong phrag bdun cus te /
analyzed: de nas thos par gyur pa dang lha nyid stong phrag bdun cus te /
translated: Then, having heard them, the gods themselves, seventy thousand in number,

original: dam pa'i chos la gus pa dang / bag med pa'ang shas chung bar gyur pas gang na 'thab bral rnams kyi lha'i sa yod pa'i gang la rma bya'i rgyal po rnam par bkra ba 'di'i legs par bkra ba dang bcas nas chos ston par byed par babs par gyur to //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la gus pa dang / bag med pa'ang shas chung bar gyur pas gang na 'thab bral rnams kyi lha'i sa yod pa'i gang la rma bya'i rgyal po rnam par bkra ba 'di'i legs par bkra ba dang bcas nas chos ston par byed par babs par gyur to //
translated: with their respect for the true Dharma and their carelessness greatly reduced, descend to the place where the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife are, where the king of peacocks, with his beautiful colors, teaches the Dharma.

original: de nas dga' ldan gyi lha rnams babs par rig nas rma bya'i rgyal po de ches rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'i yid kyis rjod par byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du bde bar 'ongs sam /
analyzed: de nas dga' ldan gyi lha rnams babs par rig nas rma bya'i rgyal po de ches rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'i yid kyis rjod par byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du bde bar 'ongs sam /
translated: Then, knowing that the gods of Tushita had descended, the king of peacocks, with a mind of great joy, said:

original: kye ye yang dag pa'i lha rnams //
analyzed: kye ye yang dag pa'i lha rnams //
translated: “Welcome, O gods!

original: 'dir 'ongs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'dir 'ongs pa rnams ni /
translated: You have come here

original: bag med pa nyams chung bas rnam par rgyu ba dang / 'di dang pha rol rjes su dpyod par byed pa dang / chos rnam pa du ma nyan pas babs par gyur ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bag med pa nyams chung bas rnam par rgyu ba dang / 'di dang pha rol rjes su dpyod par byed pa dang / chos rnam pa du ma nyan pas babs par gyur ba yin mod kyi /
translated: to enjoy yourselves, to reflect on this life and the next, and to listen to the many teachings.

original: khyed rnams ji lta bar bdag cag gi chos nyon dang de bzhin du bdag gis bstan @65b par bya'o //
analyzed: khyed rnams ji lta bar bdag cag gi chos nyon dang de bzhin du bdag gis bstan @65b par bya'o //
translated: Listen to my Dharma, just as you have come here, and I will teach it to you.

original: shis pa thabs su gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer legs par 'thob par byed pa thams cad kyis sngar ma mthong ba gang bdag skye ba gzhan zhig tu ming gyur pa na /
analyzed: shis pa thabs su gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer legs par 'thob par byed pa thams cad kyis sngar ma mthong ba gang bdag skye ba gzhan zhig tu ming gyur pa na /
translated: I will teach you the path that leads to the city of nirvana, which is auspicious, skillful, and the means to attain it.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba 'jig gi spyan snga nas thos pa de skye ba gzhan rjes su dran pa dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis ngas da rung dran zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba 'jig gi spyan snga nas thos pa de skye ba gzhan rjes su dran pa dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis ngas da rung dran zhing /
translated: “The Blessed One Krakucchanda taught this to me in the past, and I remember it now because of my recollection of past lives and the power of my aspirations.

original: gzhan dag rnams la nye bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnams la nye bar ston par byed do //
translated: I have also taught it to others.”

original: de nas dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams kyis rma bya'i rgyal po de'i drung nas tshig dag nye bar thos nas nam mkha'i dkyil nas babs te dam pa'i chos la gus pas tshim par gyur pa'i yid kyis thams cad kyang ri de'i rtse mo 'bab chu dang
analyzed: de nas dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams kyis rma bya'i rgyal po de'i drung nas tshig dag nye bar thos nas nam mkha'i dkyil nas babs te dam pa'i chos la gus pas tshim par gyur pa'i yid kyis thams cad kyang ri de'i rtse mo 'bab chu dang
translated: “When the gods of the Heaven of Joy hear these words from the king of peacocks, they will descend from the sky and, with minds satisfied by their devotion to the sacred Dharma, they will all go to the peak of that mountain, which is filled with waterfalls,

original: rdzing bu phal che ba dang nags dang nye ba'i nags rnams phun sum tshogs pa dang padma'i rdzing bu dang rin po che'i khams rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / bya brgya stong du mas rnam par rjod par byed pas mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: rdzing bu phal che ba dang nags dang nye ba'i nags rnams phun sum tshogs pa dang padma'i rdzing bu dang rin po che'i khams rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / bya brgya stong du mas rnam par rjod par byed pas mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: pools, forests, and parks, and which is endowed with lotus ponds and precious substances. Hundreds of thousands of birds sing there,

original: rin po che'i khams kyi 'byung khungs rnams dang ldan pa'i ri nor bu'i cha shas kyis rnam par bkra ba'i ri'i rtse mo de la lha de dag gis rma bya'i rgyal po de yongs su bskor nas kun tu gnas so //
analyzed: rin po che'i khams kyi 'byung khungs rnams dang ldan pa'i ri nor bu'i cha shas kyis rnam par bkra ba'i ri'i rtse mo de la lha de dag gis rma bya'i rgyal po de yongs su bskor nas kun tu gnas so //
translated: The king of peacocks is surrounded by the gods.

original: gzugs dang brtan pa dang rgya chen por gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo rnams thams cad las 'di lhag par gyur pas 'thab bral gyi lha de dag gi drung na ches lhag @66a *//🔽par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang brtan pa dang rgya chen por gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo rnams thams cad las 'di lhag par gyur pas 'thab bral gyi lha de dag gi drung na ches lhag @66a *// par gyur pa ni /
translated: Since he is superior to all in terms of form, firmness, and greatness, he is even more outstanding in the presence of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: ji ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi khyad par gyis 'thab bral ba rnams thabs thams cad kyis bla lhag pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi khyad par gyis 'thab bral ba rnams thabs thams cad kyis bla lhag pa yin no //
translated: Just as the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife are superior to the humans of Jambudvīpa in every respect,

original: de bzhin du dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams 'thab bral ba'i drung na bla lhag pa gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams 'thab bral ba'i drung na bla lhag pa gyur pa yin no //
translated: in the same way the gods of the Heaven of Joy are superior to the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: de nas 'thab bral ba de dag gis dga' ldan pa de dag rnams mngon par mthong nas gzugs kyi rgyags pa dang dbang phyug dang rgya chen po nye bar bcom par gyur pas /
analyzed: de nas 'thab bral ba de dag gis dga' ldan pa de dag rnams mngon par mthong nas gzugs kyi rgyags pa dang dbang phyug dang rgya chen po nye bar bcom par gyur pas /
translated: “When the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife see the gods of the Heaven of Joy, they will be humbled by the power of their physical beauty, their majesty, and their greatness.

original: gang na rma bya'i mnga' bdag yod par gyur pa der nye bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: gang na rma bya'i mnga' bdag yod par gyur pa der nye bar 'gro'o //
translated: They will then approach the lord of the peacocks.

original: 'ga' zhig dang 'ga' zhig ni; rtse ba la dga' bar gyur pas nags dang nye ba'i nags dag tu zhugs so //🔽ji ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi khyad par gyis 'thab bral ba rnams tshul thams cad kyis khyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dang 'ga' zhig ni; rtse ba la dga' bar gyur pas nags dang nye ba'i nags dag tu zhugs so // ji ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi khyad par gyis 'thab bral ba rnams tshul thams cad kyis khyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
translated: Some of them will enter the forests and parks to enjoy themselves.🔽The gods of the Heaven Free from Strife are superior to the humans of Jambudvīpa in every respect.

original: de ltar dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams 'thab bral ba de dag gi drung na'ang bla lhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams 'thab bral ba de dag gi drung na'ang bla lhag pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the gods of the Heaven of Joy are superior to the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife in every respect.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: “Some of the gods of the Heaven of Joy will then proceed to the forest known as Delightful.

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / ngo mtshar bar gyur pa'i phyir yang dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams nyid la kun nas mngon par lta zhing gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / ngo mtshar bar gyur pa'i phyir yang dga' ldan gyi lha de dag rnams nyid la kun nas mngon par lta zhing gnas par gyur to //
translated: Because they had never seen such a thing before, and because it was so amazing, they all gathered around and looked at the gods of the Heaven of Joy.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some of them

original: slar nyid kyang ri'i rtse mo de dag nyid la rtse ba'i don du mngon par 'khod par byed do //
analyzed: slar nyid kyang ri'i rtse mo de dag nyid la rtse ba'i don du mngon par 'khod par byed do //
translated: returned to the mountain peaks to play.

original: de nas dga' ldan pa de dag dang 'thab bral ba de dag rnams kyis rma bya'i rgyal po de la yongs su bskor @66b nas de na gnas so //
analyzed: de nas dga' ldan pa de dag dang 'thab bral ba de dag rnams kyis rma bya'i rgyal po de la yongs su bskor @66b nas de na gnas so //
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of Joy and the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife surrounded the king of peacocks and stayed there.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' des de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' des de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva said to them,

original: lha dag ji ltar chos la gus pa la goms pa'i dbang gis lha dang mi rnams la phan pa'i don gang yin pa dang / mchog tu bde ba dang / sems can rnams thams cad la phan pa'i sems can thams cad lha dang mi rnams la yang dag par 'god pa ni /
analyzed: lha dag ji ltar chos la gus pa la goms pa'i dbang gis lha dang mi rnams la phan pa'i don gang yin pa dang / mchog tu bde ba dang / sems can rnams thams cad la phan pa'i sems can thams cad lha dang mi rnams la yang dag par 'god pa ni /
translated: “Gods, because of the power of habituation to respect for the Dharma, I will explain to you gods and humans what is beneficial, what is supremely blissful, and how to establish all beings in benefit and happiness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag rnams kyis ni /
translated: These twenty-two qualities

original: lha dang mi rnams 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu'ang phan pa dang bde ba dang sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba gang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu'ang phan pa dang bde ba dang sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba gang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: are what is beneficial, happy, attractive, and delightful for gods and humans in this world and the next.

original: chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po gang gis bag med pa rnams kun nas 'dor ba dang / chud gson par byed pa dang med par byed pa dang / de dang bral bas kyang bde ba mtha' yas par gyur pa lha dang mi rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par byed pa dang /
analyzed: chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po gang gis bag med pa rnams kun nas 'dor ba dang / chud gson par byed pa dang med par byed pa dang / de dang bral bas kyang bde ba mtha' yas par gyur pa lha dang mi rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par byed pa dang /
translated: The twenty-two qualities that destroy, waste, and eliminate the careless and that lead to infinite happiness for gods and humans, culminating in the transcendence of suffering,

original: ji ltar mas ma yin zhing phas kyang ma yin pa rnams chos kyis de bzhin du phan par 'gyur ba de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mas ma yin zhing phas kyang ma yin pa rnams chos kyis de bzhin du phan par 'gyur ba de dag gang zhe na /
translated: are the qualities that benefit gods and humans in a way that is not done by mothers or fathers. What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'gyod pa dang / ngan song gi 'jigs pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / chos ston pa dang / snying rje dang / sems rab tu 'dul ba dang / rab tu rten ba dang / las la dad pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang / ngan song gi 'jigs pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / chos ston pa dang / snying rje dang / sems rab tu 'dul ba dang / rab tu rten ba dang / las la dad pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: remorse, fear of the miserable destinies, patience, effort, teaching the Dharma, compassion, well-disciplined mind, well-established, faith in action,

original: grags pa ma yin pas 'jigs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / @67a *//
analyzed: grags pa ma yin pas 'jigs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / @67a *//
translated: fear of disrepute, non-attachment, delight in solitude,

original: sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / gzugs dang dbang phyug dang rigs dang nad med pa'i rgyags pa dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pas nye bar bcom pa dang / brtan po dang / ngag 'jam po dang /
analyzed: sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / gzugs dang dbang phyug dang rigs dang nad med pa'i rgyags pa dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pas nye bar bcom pa dang / brtan po dang / ngag 'jam po dang /
translated: undistracted mind, mindfulness of death, freedom from the intoxication of form, sovereignty, family, and health, being overcome by non-abiding, being steadfast, having gentle speech,

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / chog shes pa dang / yul rnams 'jigs par lta ba dang / sems la yid ches par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / chog shes pa dang / yul rnams 'jigs par lta ba dang / sems la yid ches par mi bya ba'o //
translated: equality towards all beings, contentment, seeing objects as fearful, and not trusting the mind.

original: de la chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po de dag rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsten par gyur pa na lha'am mi rnams kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po de dag rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsten par gyur pa na lha'am mi rnams kyang rung ste /
translated: If these twenty-two qualities are practiced properly, then whether one is a god or a human,

original: ngan song gis rnams la skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song gis rnams la skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one will not be born in the lower realms.

original: mya ngan las 'das par yang myur bar thob par byed do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par yang myur bar thob par byed do //
translated: One will also quickly attain nirvana.

original: de la ji ltar 'gyod par byed par bya ba yin zhing ji ltar na thams cad kyang bde legs par spyod pa yin na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'gyod par byed par bya ba yin zhing ji ltar na thams cad kyang bde legs par spyod pa yin na /
translated: How should one regret what one has done? How should one practice everything well?

original: yid la gcags pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du byas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: yid la gcags pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du byas par gyur na ni /
translated: If one is remorseful in every way,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kun nas 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kun nas 'joms par byed do //
translated: then one will destroy all wholesome qualities.

original: de la 'di ji ltar byas par gyur nas yin na /
analyzed: de la 'di ji ltar byas par gyur nas yin na /
translated: How is it that one does this?

original: gal te'ang 'di na gzhan 'ga' zhig mi dge ba rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kyang byed par gyur pa na ni; des dge slong 'di skyug bro bar blta bar bya ba dang / rnam par smod par byed pa dang gang yid la gcags par gyur pa byed la de dang lhan cig tu @67b gnas par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: gal te'ang 'di na gzhan 'ga' zhig mi dge ba rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kyang byed par gyur pa na ni; des dge slong 'di skyug bro bar blta bar bya ba dang / rnam par smod par byed pa dang gang yid la gcags par gyur pa byed la de dang lhan cig tu @67b gnas par yang mi byed do //
translated: If someone else were to engage in nonvirtuous actions with their body, speech, or mind, they would regard that monk as disgusting, condemn them, and regret their actions. They would not associate with them.

original: de nas yang gal te bdag nyid kyis ji zhig ltar rkyen gyi dbang gis byas par gyur tam /
analyzed: de nas yang gal te bdag nyid kyis ji zhig ltar rkyen gyi dbang gis byas par gyur tam /
translated: “If they themselves were to engage in such actions due to circumstances,

original: sems la yang rnam par rtog pa kun tu skyes par gyur na; de skyes par gyur pa tsam nyid na'ang rab tu 'joms so //
analyzed: sems la yang rnam par rtog pa kun tu skyes par gyur na; de skyes par gyur pa tsam nyid na'ang rab tu 'joms so //
translated: or if such thoughts were to arise in their minds, they would immediately destroy them.

original: phyir nyid kyang ro myang par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyir nyid kyang ro myang par mi byed do //
translated: They would not savor them.

original: gang dag gis 'phrog par gyur na'ang gzhan dag gi drung du mthol bar byed do; ;'di 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba la'ang kun nas 'bad par byed cing sems kyis 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag gis 'phrog par gyur na'ang gzhan dag gi drung du mthol bar byed do; ;'di 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba la'ang kun nas 'bad par byed cing sems kyis 'bad par byed do //
translated: If they were to steal, they would confess it to others. They would strive to prevent such actions from occurring again and would apply themselves with their minds.

original: de kho na bzhin du phyir zhing dang / de dag nyid la slar yang dang sems rab tu gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du phyir zhing dang / de dag nyid la slar yang dang sems rab tu gnas par mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, he does not settle his mind again and again on those very things.

original: des mi dge ba'i chos rnam par rtog pa de ltar smre bar byed do //
analyzed: des mi dge ba'i chos rnam par rtog pa de ltar smre bar byed do //
translated: He loathes those unwholesome thoughts.

original: dper na rtug pa dang / khyi'i ro mgul bar bcings pa'am mi gtsang ba rnams 'ga' zhig tu bcug par gyur na /
analyzed: dper na rtug pa dang / khyi'i ro mgul bar bcings pa'am mi gtsang ba rnams 'ga' zhig tu bcug par gyur na /
translated: For example, if a dog’s corpse is tied around the neck or put in the house of someone who desires purity,

original: mi gtsang ba de dag rnams dang / khyi'i ro de dag la yang gtsang ma 'dod pa'i skyes bu rnams skyug log par byed do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba de dag rnams dang / khyi'i ro de dag la yang gtsang ma 'dod pa'i skyes bu rnams skyug log par byed do //
translated: that person who desires purity will vomit and will be disgusted by those impurities and by the dog’s corpse.

original: de ltar dge slong mi dge ba'i chos yid la byed pa la skyug bro bar byed do //🔽rnam par gshe'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong mi dge ba'i chos yid la byed pa la skyug bro bar byed do // rnam par gshe'o //
translated: In the same way, the monk is disgusted by unwholesome thoughts.🔽He loathes them.

original: 'gyod par yang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod par yang byed pa yin no //
translated: He regrets them.

original: dper na yang skyes bu gzhan 'ga' zhig gtsang ma 'dod pa /
analyzed: dper na yang skyes bu gzhan 'ga' zhig gtsang ma 'dod pa /
translated: For example, if a person who desires purity,

original: gtsang ma la bsten pa /
analyzed: gtsang ma la bsten pa /
translated: who relies on purity,

original: gtsang ma rnams la so sor skyabs su song ba dag brgya lam zhig na ba shang ba za bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gtsang ma rnams la so sor skyabs su song ba dag brgya lam zhig na ba shang ba za bar byed pa yin te /
translated: who has taken refuge in purity, were to eat dog meat,

original: gal te shed na mi shes pas sam /
analyzed: gal te shed na mi shes pas sam /
translated: If he is not aware of it,

original: byis par @68a *//
analyzed: byis par @68a *//
translated: or if he is a child,

original: gyur pas gzhan grogs po ma yin pa dag gis zar bcug par gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gyur pas gzhan grogs po ma yin pa dag gis zar bcug par gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: or if he is led astray by others who are not his friends,

original: des mi gtsang ba de rnam par smod par byed cing sme bar byed la phyis kyang kun nas za bar mi byed par des kyang 'gyod par byed do //
analyzed: des mi gtsang ba de rnam par smod par byed cing sme bar byed la phyis kyang kun nas za bar mi byed par des kyang 'gyod par byed do //
translated: he will still feel disgust and contempt for that impurity, and he will not continue to enjoy it.

original: de kho na bzhin du dge slong ngam de'i rigs can gzhan dag rnams kyang rung ste gang 'ga' zhig dge ba rjes su tshol ba rnams la ci zhig ltar mi dge ba'i yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag skyes par gyur na'ang rnam par smod par
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du dge slong ngam de'i rigs can gzhan dag rnams kyang rung ste gang 'ga' zhig dge ba rjes su tshol ba rnams la ci zhig ltar mi dge ba'i yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag skyes par gyur na'ang rnam par smod par
translated: In the same way, if a monk or someone of his kind, who is seeking virtue, should happen to give rise to unwholesome thoughts,

original: byed do // sme bar byed do //
analyzed: byed do // sme bar byed do //
translated: he will feel disgust and contempt for them.

original: gang dag gis khrid par gyur pa na de dag yang mi skye bar bya ba'i don du sems skyed par byed cing dge ba la'ang spyod par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag gis khrid par gyur pa na de dag yang mi skye bar bya ba'i don du sems skyed par byed cing dge ba la'ang spyod par byed do //
translated: And if he is led astray by them, he will arouse his mind to the point of not giving rise to them again, and he will practice virtue.

original: 'di ni // bag med pa rnams par 'joms pa dang / bag med pa rlag par byed pa dang bag med pa rnams 'jig par byed pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyi chos dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni // bag med pa rnams par 'joms pa dang / bag med pa rlag par byed pa dang bag med pa rnams 'jig par byed pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyi chos dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first teaching for gods and humans who are heedless, who are lost in heedlessness, who are destroyed by heedlessness.

original: de'i phyi skyes bu dam pa de kho na nyid tshol ba rnams dang / 'khor ba'i 'jigs pas 'jigs pa gang yin pa rnams kyis 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /

translated: “ ‘After that, those who are good people, who seek reality, and who are afraid of the dangers of cyclic existence should train as follows:

original: mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa phra ba'i phra ba yid la skyes par gyur na'ang 'gyod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa phra ba'i phra ba yid la skyes par gyur na'ang 'gyod par bya'o //
translated: “ ‘If even the most subtle unwholesome thoughts arise in the mind, one should feel regret.

original: 'dir ni / bag yod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni / bag yod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, one should be heedful.

original: skad cig kyang bag med par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig kyang bag med par ni mi bya'o //

original: de lta bas na mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rtsa ba gcig bur gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rtsa ba gcig bur gyur pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the single root of unwholesome phenomena

original: @68b 'di lta ste /

translated: is as follows:

original: ro myang bar byed pa dang yid la gcags par byed pa ste /

original: chos dang po yin no //
analyzed: chos dang po yin no //

original: chos gzhan yang dge ba kun tu 'phel bar byed pa dag yod de /
